names.Name: an athletic lady walking her dog who has been exiled from a nearby plaza
a sweaty man in a business suit who doesn't realize he is completely intangible
a man dressed as Santa Claus, homesick for the North Pole
a woman drinking from a bottle of wine as she power walks is actually asleep
two siblings wearing matching clothes, mimicking each other and the people around them
a father munching on corn nuts while pushing a stroller with an infant who is psychic
a vulgar rabbit that multiplies whenever nobody is looking
a hateful mongoose proudly wearing four snakeskin boots
an impatient stork in messenger outfit delivering a baby to the PC group
a nervous human-size praying mantis in a beautiful bridal gown
a wounded spotted elephant calf made of clay with jewels for spots
a rustic country bear wearing a sheet with eye holes cut in it, looking at a compass
rude child-sized mannequin obsessed with going to the bathroom and other bodily functions
sociable well-dressed normal-sized mannequin without facial features obsessed with sex
normal-sized mannequin wearing a mask obsessed with eating
normal-sized fragrant mannequin obsessed with getting sick
child-sized mannequin walking on their hands and obsessed with the concept of sleeping
very polite normal-sized mannequin obsessed with the idea of growing older
nostalgic older man who desires a random object from a store in a different plaza
woman tangled in a net struggling to free herself desires an object they know someone in a random faction has
an idle young man, hands in pockets, desires an object one of the PCs brought into the mall
a kid with a metal detector looking for the same thing a PC desires
a wary woman with very long hair seeks a random object from the upper or lower levels
a conspiratorial cloaked figure desires a Banned object
a very comfortable looking padded rocking chair, has a saintly aura
a cast iron frying pan perpetually cooking two sunny side up eggs and bacon, proud of its heavenly smell
a large padlock and key who are all over each other, helpful, but distracted
a grandfather clock with stopped hands stoicly waiting for the hour to turn
an extremely rare comic book in plastic sleeve, curious about its insides
a bitter matchstick, discarded on the ground, questioning its purpose
a jogging necromancer concerned about heart rate, skeleton servant holds water bottle
a cloaked clothing assassin who stabs people with knives of chocolate to stain and ruin their clothing
a bored sphinx who designs mazes, will follow the PCs around and heckle them
philosophical scarlet macaws speculate on the nature of the Mall
exhausted adventuring party on quest to slay an evil taco
a unicorn who escaped from a closed store and wants someone to remove its horn so it can stay off the grid
a rowdy buck naked guy looking for a clothing store
a girl group in matching outfits to perform at the opening of the Christown Spectrum Mall in Phoenix in 1961, looking for a mirror to touch up their makeup
a very uncomfortable bloated man is desperately looking for a pharmacy
an energetic child is pulling his tired mom through the Mall to find a toy store
a frantic woman who smells distressingly like gunpowder is looking for a perfume store
a worldly man with snakes for hair is looking for a hairdresser
a frustrated bodybuilder whose voice sounds like a toilet flushing
flirtatious well-dressed man with fluorescent light bulb for a head, good for another 15,000 hours at least
a wailing cyborg unable to bend over to tie its untied shoe
a dismayed clockwork wolf that can't resist the urge to bite
an irritated android in a tuxedo covered in chocolate stains
a futuristic digital watch frozen at 12:22 whose answers are always right during that minute, a line of people waiting to ask it questions
a light shifter; too many claws, only visible by the way it makes light bend, curious about humans' fragility
the ghost of a killed wanderer; it might be searching for its murderer
a lost teen, looking for a way out; knows one true fact and one false
a hobo; they've survived here for a long time, mostly by hiding, and don't intend to change that
a hollow janitor; though appearing human, they shelter thousands of flies
a shadow creature, feeding off the shadows of others, fears bright lights and fires
a plastic hound, pet of the security staff with small plastic wings
conscious clothing, mostly concerned with passing as human
a fake child; the mouths on their belly often scare potential friends
a wandering plastic animal, forgotten by the mall
a person in a hot dog suit, recruited for a long-dead advertising stint
1d6 plastic crows, watching ominously from afar
a member of Mannequins for Freedom
a member of Freed From Green!
a member of the Collectors
a member of the Council of Objects
a Servant of the Mall
a Mall Upgrader
a perpetually wet person, wanting free of the curse
a fake plastic version of the friend
a self-proclaimed guide, expensive and mostly ignorant
a customer from the PCs' world, completely lost
a self-constructed robot, wandering around
1d6 journalists investigating the Mall, trying to understand how deep the mystery goes
1d6 cops sent to a normal mall to investigate a murder, now way over their head
1d6 robbers of a regular mall who didn't plan for this
1d6 employees of a regular mall who got lost during a lunch break
a trickster vending machine on wheels, specialized in cutting off unsuspecting limbs
a lone survivor who became Odd a long time ago and deeply regrets it
a spelunker/mountaineer, determined to get to the very bottom or very top of the Mall, where surely there's an exit
a majestic hydra with realistic celebrity human faces covering its heads as a disguise
a stoic unicorn who wants someone to remove its horn so it can blend in
a contagious harpy with the face of a little girl, sleeping in a mound of garbage
a vulgar peryton who buys clothing for its human shadow, eats hearts
a vegan dragon wearing a leash who collects a random type of object, has ventured from its nearby hoard
a vulnerable spitting Midas cockatrice, saliva turns things to gold
a starving walrus carpenter wearing overalls
two tense sister electricians installing some kind of surveillance device
a wisecracking lawnmower man landscaper
a haunted construction crew
a helpful garbageman emptying the plaza's trashcan
a mindless plumber messing with the sprinkler system
worker of one of the plaza stores, running late
worker of one of the plaza stores, leaving shift
worker of one of the plaza stores, first day on the job
worker of one of the plaza stores, very pissed off today
worker of one of the plaza stores, slack motherfucker
worker of one of the plaza stores, frozen motionless
an optimistic spayed cat who has outlived a half dozen of its human caretakers is going to a pet store to buy kittens
a hopeful pigeon who has heard about an outdoor plaza (one with an artificial sky)
inconsolable former scar model sobbing quietly, tried a new lotion from cosmetic store and it removed her scars
a mermaid frozen in a block of ice alongside an odd object
a suspicious member of the teenage FBI looking for secret passages
a desperate fish who is a transformed collector of books
a living flame, actually a person wearing fireproof fire camouflage suit
an offduty licensed spitter, probably a kid
an idle teenager, waiting to be struck by lightning
a knight in platemail riding a bicycle
Jesper, freelance genie, dressed like a tourist
someone dressed in a costume of one of the PCs, famished
